Package org.daisy.streamline.api.config

Provides means for adding configuration catalogs.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ConfigurationsCatalogService
    Provides an interface for a ConfigurationsCatalog service.
    ConfigurationsProvider
    Provides an interface for configurations providers.
    ExclusiveAccess
    Defines inter-process exclusive access signaling.
    UserConfigurationsProvider
    Provides an interface for user configurations providers.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConfigurationDetails
    Provides details about a configuration.
    ConfigurationDetails.Builder
    Provides a configuration details builder.
    ConfigurationsCatalog
    Provides a catalog of configurations available to the input system.
    UserConfigurationsCollection
    Provides a user configuration collection that lets a user add and remove configurations at runtime.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ConfigurationsProviderException
    Indicates conditions that a reasonable application might want to catch.
    ExclusiveAccessException
    Provides an exception for situations where exclusive access could not be obtained.

Package org.daisy.streamline.api.config Description

Provides means for adding configuration catalogs. A configuration catalog is a map with a title and a description. The title and description are used for selecting a configuration and the map contains key/value combinations for that configuration.

A catalog can be added by creating a new java project, implementing ConfigurationsProvider and adding the file org.daisy.streamline.api.config.ConfigurationsProvider to the META-INF/services folder. This file should contain a qualified reference to the new implementation. Package the result as a jar-file and included in the classpath.
